info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 2:28PM MDT until September 13 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR BERNALILLO COUNTY... At 228 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Albuquerque, Corrales, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, North Valley, Paradise Hills, South Valley and Alameda. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 153 and 166. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 221 and 232. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In addition to torrential rains, strong winds and hail can also be expected. Accumulation of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions. Do not underestimate the power of flood waters. Only a few inches of rapidly flowing water can quickly carry away your vehicle.
